intro.Doc-title: BUSINESS MEETING: MARKUP OF COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-19
intro.option: ADMINISTRATION HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ONE HUNDRED FIFTEENTH CONGRESS SECOND SESSION __________ JUNE 26, 2018 __________ Printed for the use of the Committee on House Administration [GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] Available on the Internet: https://www.govinfo.gov/committee/house-administration __________ U.S. GOVERNMENT PUBLISHING OFFICE 33-061 WASHINGTON : 2018 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Publishing Office, http://bookstore.gpo.gov. For more information, contact the GPO Customer Contact Center, U.S. Government Publishing Office. Phone 202-512-1800, or 866-512-1800 (toll-free). E-mail, gpo@custhelp.com. Committee on House Administration GREGG HARPER, Mississippi, Chairman RODNEY DAVIS, Illinois, Vice ROBERT A. BRADY, Pennsylvania, Chairman Ranking Member BARBARA COMSTOCK, Virginia ZOE LOFGREN, California MARK WALKER, North Carolina JAMIE RASKIN, Maryland ADRIAN SMITH, Nebraska BARRY LOUDERMILK, Georgia
intro.Doc-title: BUSINESS MEETING: MARKUP OF COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-19
intro.paragraph: The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 11:06 a.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [Chairman of the Committee] presiding.
intro.hearing-info: Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Walker, Smith, Loudermilk, and Brady.
intro.paragraph: Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director/Policy and Oversight; Steven Wall, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Amanda Anger, Professional Staff Member; Matt Field, Director of Oversight; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Khalil Abboud, Minority Deputy Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk.
The Chairman. I now call to order the Committee on House

Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director/Policy and Oversight; Steven Wall, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Amanda Anger, Professional Staff Member; Matt Field, Director of Oversight; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Khalil Abboud, Minority Deputy Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's Committee meeting. A quorum is present, so we may proceed.
The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so that Members may submit any materials that they wish to be included therein.

There is one item on our docket today, Committee Resolution 115-19, a resolution to disburse $200,000 from the Committee's Reserve Fund to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. This disbursement is in response to a request the Committee received from the Chairman and Ranking Member of the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

The disbursement will provide resources for the Committee on Veterans' Affairs to establish a new Technology Modernization Subcommittee. This new subcommittee will focus its oversight efforts on the VA's $15.8 billion Electronic Health Record Modernization Program, by far the largest electronic health record transition ever attempted as well as one of the Federal Government's biggest IT projects.
I would now like to recognize my colleague and the Committee's Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement.
intro.speaker: Mr. Brady

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: Thank you, Mr. Chairman.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: Mr. Chairman, I support the funding request for the Veterans' Committee. And I have received assurances from the Ranking Member that he will have access to one-third of the funds, consistent with their tradition of how money is spent on a committee--for a committee is handled.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: With that assurance, I support the request and urge my colleagues to do the same.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: And I yield back.
intro.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back
The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Does any other Member wish to be recognized for the purpose of an opening statement?

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: I now call up and lay before the Committee Committee Resolution 115-19. Without objection, the first reading is dispensed with, and the resolution is considered read and open for amendment.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [The information follows:]

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [[GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT]

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: The Chairman. Would any Member like to make a statement or

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [[GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] offer an amendment?

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Seeing none, I move the Committee adopt Committee Resolution 115-19.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: The question is on the motion.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: All those in favor, signify by saying aye.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: All those opposed, signify by saying nay.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it, and the motion is agreed to.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Does any Member wish to submit supplemental or minority views?

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Seeing none, for all the matters considered here today, I would ask unanimous consent that the staff be authorized to make technical and conforming changes if necessary.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Without objection, so ordered.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: That concludes today's markup. Without objection, the markup is adjourned.
